name: Partner and Multi-Account: Manage Partners
title: Partner and Multi-Account: Manage Partners
body:
From the Partners tab, you can view, edit, and delete your partners. From the Partner information page, you can also view and archive accounts managed by your partners. If you select the domain of an account managed by a partner account, you will be able to view and manage the account as an admin.

Tip:If you're looking for information about the accounts you manage, see our Partner/Multi-Account: Viewing Your Accounts article.

Managing Partners

To view your managed partners, navigate to the Partners tab of your Account Management console. For more information about this tab, see the screenshot and list below:

  1. + Create Partner: Click this button to add a new partner.
  2. Organization: This column displays the name of the organization. You can click the name of the organization in this column to access the partner’s information.
  3. Domain: This column displays the partner’s domain.
  4. Download CSV: Click this button to download a CSV file that contains information about your partners. 
  5. Impersonate Partner: Click this icon to impersonate the partner’s account management console as a child partner admin. This option is only available for your management console admins with Full Access Admin permissions.
  6. Actions: Click this drop-down menu and select Edit to make changes to a partner account.

Creating a New Partner

To create a new partner account, follow the steps below:

  1. From the Partners tab, click the + New Partner button. When you click this button, the New Partner pop-up window will open.
  2. Fill out the fields in the Personal Information and Organization Information sections with information about the partner.
  3. Fill out the fields in the Account Management Admin Settings section with your preferred settings for the partner account. From the Account Session Timeout drop-down menu, you can select the session timeout window to apply to the account. This setting will determine the maximum amount of idle time allowed before an admin will be logged out of the account.
  4. If you would like to enable SAML for the partner account, fill out the fields in the SAML section.
  5. Fill out the fields in the Purchased Products and Add-ons section. In the Number of Purchased Seats field, make sure to enter the number of seats the partner account purchased. Also, make sure the Subscription End Date fields both accurately reflect the partner account's KnowBe4 subscription period.
  6. Click Create Partner.

Editing an Existing Partner

To edit an existing partner account, follow the steps below:

  1. From the Partners tab, click the Edit button next to the partner account you would like to edit.
  2. Update any fields that need to be updated.
  3. Click Update Partner to save your edits.

Managing KnowBe4 Accounts Under Managed Partners

On the Partner Information page, you can view information about the partner accounts and any accounts they manage. For more information, see the screenshot and list below:

  1. Accounts: This subtab displays a list of accounts that the partner manages.
  2. Status: Click this drop-down menu to filter the Accounts list by account status. You can select Active to view a list of all active accounts, Archived to view all archived accounts, or All to view a list of archived and active accounts.
  3. Billing Type: Click this drop-down menu to filter the Accounts list by billing type. You can select Paid, Trial, or Free. You can also select Any to view a list of all accounts managed by the partner.
  4. Search by domain or name: Use this field to search for specific accounts.
  5. Organization: Select the name of the organization's Account Information page. From the organization’s Account Information page, you can edit the account and view the account as an admin. For more information about managing accounts, see our Partner/Multi-Account: Viewing Your Accounts article.
  6. Actions: Click this drop-down menu to refresh the account’s Phish-prone Percentages.
  7. View as Partner Admin: Click this icon to impersonate the partner’s account management console as a child partner admin. This option is only available for your management console admins with Full Access Admin permissions.

images.alt:
This image displays the **Partners** management page within the **KnowBe4** security awareness platform.

**Overall Context:**
The interface shows a list view of registered partners, featuring a navigation bar, controls for management, and a detailed data table.

**Key UI Elements and Text:**

1.  **Header and Navigation:** The top bar features the **KnowBe4** logo and a primary navigation menu with links: DASHBOARD, ACCOUNTS, PHISHING, TRAINING, **PARTNERS** (currently selected/active), ADMINS, MODSTORE, and REPORTS.
2.  **Page Title:** Below the main navigation, the page is titled "**Partners**" accompanied by a globe icon.
3.  **Management Controls:**
    *   **(a) Create Partner:** A prominent blue button labeled **"+ Create Partner"** is located in the top-right of the content area.
    *   **(d) Data Export/Search:** Controls include a green button labeled "**Download CSV**," a search bar placeholder text "**Search by name or email...**," and a gear icon dropdown for settings/filtering.
4.  **Data Table Structure:** The main content is a table listing partners, identified by the following column headers (all sortable, indicated by up/down arrows):
    *   **(b) Organization**
    *   **(c) Domain**
    *   Partner Type (e.g., "Reseller")
    *   Join Date
    *   Subscription
    *   End Date
    *   PhishER End Date
    *   Bulk Purchased Seats
    *   \# Accounts
    *   \# Users
    *   \# Bulk Users
    *   **(f) Actions** (Dropdown menu per row)
5.  **Data Rows:** The table displays two obscured partner entries.
    *   **(e) Row Details (Example):** The first row shows a Partner Type of "**Reseller**," a Join Date of "**01/20/2020**," Subscription of "**N/A**," End Date of "**01/20/2020**," and 0 counts for Seats, Accounts, Users, and Bulk Users.
6.  **Footer Status:** A status message at the bottom left reads: "**Displaying all 2 rows**."
7.  **Copyright and Links:** The interface footer includes copyright information: "**© 2023 KnowBe4, Inc. All rights reserved**," along with links for About, Privacy Policy, and Need Help?.
images.context: For more information about this tab, see the screenshot and list below:

images.alt:
This image displays a vertically arranged, multi-section user input form designed for collecting detailed personal and organizational data.

**Section 1: Personal Information**
This section header is titled "Personal Information." It contains three input fields:
1. **Email:** A text input field labeled "Email." The label includes a small question mark icon (help/tooltip indicator).
2. **First Name:** A text input field labeled "First Name."
3. **Last Name:** A text input field labeled "Last Name."
*Note: First Name and Last Name fields are displayed side-by-side on the same row.*

**Section 2: Organization Information**
This section header is titled "Organization Information." It consists of multiple data entry fields:
1. **Partner Type:** A dropdown menu labeled "Partner Type." The current value displayed is "Reseller."
2. **Organization Name:** A text input field labeled "Organization Name."
3. **Street Address 1:** A text input field labeled "Street Address 1."
4. **Street Address 2:** A text input field labeled "Street Address 2." (Displayed on the left half of the row).
5. **Suite Number:** A text input field labeled "Suite Number." (Displayed on the right half of the row).
6. **City:** A text input field labeled "City." (Left half).
7. **State:** A text input field labeled "State." (Right half).
8. **Zip Code:** A text input field labeled "Zip Code." (Left half).
9. **Country:** A text input field labeled "Country." (Right half).
10. **Phone Number:** A text input field labeled "Phone Number." (Left half).
11. **Extension:** A text input field labeled "Extension." (Right half).
12. **Time Zone:** A dropdown menu labeled "Time Zone." The placeholder text is "Select option."
13. **Website:** A text input field labeled "Website."
14. **Company Logo:** A file upload control labeled "Company Logo." The label includes a question mark icon. The control is presented as a button labeled "Choose File."

The entire form utilizes standard UI elements: plain text labels, rectangular input boxes, and dropdown select fields, all rendered against a white background.
images.context: sections with information about the partner.

images.alt:
The image displays a user interface section labeled **Account Management Admin Settings**, focused on session security and timeout configuration.

1.  **IP Restriction Checkboxes:**
    *   **Limit an admin's console sessions to one IP address** (Unchecked checkbox, followed by a help icon).
    *   **Only allow console sessions from specific IP ranges** (Unchecked checkbox, followed by a help icon).

2.  **Session Timeout Configuration:**
    *   **Label:** Account Session Timeout (Followed by a help icon).
    *   **Input Field:** A standard dropdown menu (Select element) with the default placeholder text **Select option**.
images.context: amount of idle time allowed before an admin will be logged out of the account.

images.alt:
The image displays a section of a user interface related to configuration settings for SAML (Security Assertion Markup Language).

**UI Elements and Context:**

1.  **Header and Status Indicator:** The primary text is "SAML", followed immediately by the current status indicator: *(Disabled)*. The status indicator is italicized and rendered in red text, denoting an inactive or critical state.
2.  **Contextual Help Icon:** A small, dark gray question mark icon enclosed in a circle is positioned to the right of the header, indicating the availability of contextual help or a tooltip.
3.  **Call-to-Action (CTA) Button:** Below the header is a light gray, rectangular button labeled "SAML Settings".
4.  **Button Icon:** The button text is prefixed by a gray plus sign icon (**+**), suggesting the action is to initiate, add, or configure the related settings. This button provides the mechanism to interact with the currently disabled SAML feature.
images.context: the partner account, fill out the fields in the SAML section.

images.alt:
This image displays a form section titled "**Purchased Products and Add-ons**," consisting of four data input fields and a single action button, arranged in two columns.

**UI Elements and Data Fields (Top Row):**

1.  **Subscription:** A dropdown menu labeled "Subscription." The placeholder text is "Select option," and the field includes a right-aligned downward arrow icon for expansion.
2.  **Number of Purchased Seats:** A numerical input field with left and right increment/decrement buttons (`-` and `+`).

**UI Elements and Data Fields (Bottom Row):**

3.  **Subscription End Date:** A date input field. It displays the pre-filled value "**08/29/2022**" and includes a calendar icon button for date selection.
4.  **PhishER Subscription End Date:** A date input field. The field is empty but includes a calendar icon button for date selection.

**Action Button:**

A solid blue button labeled "**Create Partner**" is positioned below the input fields, indicating the form submission action.
images.context: t the partner account's KnowBe4 subscription period.

images.alt:
This image depicts a **Partner Information** dashboard within a software interface, organized into detailed information panels and a data table.

**Header and Navigation:**
*   The primary title is **Partner Information for [redacted domain name]**.
*   A top-right link, **← Back to Partners**, allows navigation back to the partner list.

**Information Panels:**
1.  **Partner Information (Left Column):** Displays fundamental details in a key/value list format.
    *   Fields include: Partner Type (**Reseller**), Email (redacted), Partner Name (redacted, with an interactive icon **(g)** showing a circular logo and an arrow link), Company Name (redacted), and Address (**N/A**).
2.  **Subscription Information (Left Column, continued):** Displays subscription status.
    *   Fields include: Subscription Level (**N/A**), Subscription End Date, and PhishER Subscription End Date.
3.  **Accounts and Seats (Right Column):** Provides aggregated metrics for managed accounts.
    *   Metrics include: Total Active Accounts (**2**), Total Purchased Seats (**N/A**), Total Active Seats (**1091**), Total Active Paid Seats (**1091**), Total Active Trial Seats (**0**), and Total Active Free Seats (**0**).

**Interactive Data Table (Accounts List):**
This section displays a list of accounts managed by the partner, using a tabbed interface and filtering tools.

*   **Tabs:** Two tabs are present: **Accounts (a)** (currently active) and **Admins (c)**.
*   **Filtering Controls:** Located above the table.
    *   **Status (b):** Filter set to **Active**.
    *   **Billing Type (b):** Filter set to **Any**.
    *   A search bar (**d**) labeled **Search by domain or name...**, accompanied by a magnifying glass icon and a settings/filter icon (gear).
*   **Table Columns (e):** The table provides detailed metrics for each organization:
    *   Organization (linkable/expandable)
    *   Billing Type
    *   Date Created (Sortable)
    *   Purchased Add-ons
    *   Seats (Sortable)
    *   Users (Sortable)
    *   Phish-prone % (Sortable, accompanied by a help icon **(d)**)
    *   PSTs (Sortable)
    *   Actions (f) (Dropdown menu for row-specific actions)
*   **Data Rows:** Two rows of data are visible, showing organizations with Billing Types "Diamond" and "Paid," creation dates, seat counts (100 and 25), user counts (1089 and 2), and Phish-prone percentages (0.0% for both).
